node.title: Ko four shots off leader in Florida after mixed first round of 2022
node.description: The Kiwi shot a one-under 71 at Orlando on Friday (NZ time).
node.content: ["Kiwi golfer Lydia Ko made a mixed start to her first tournament of 2022, trailing the clubhouse leader by four shots after her opening round in Orlando, Florida.", "Returning to the course for the first time this year, Ko fired a one-over 71 in the first round of the Hilton Grand Vacations Tournament of Champions, with four birdies and three bogeys.", "The Kiwi got off to a rough start on her front nine, with back to back bogeys on the second and third holes, reaching halfway at two-over through nine holes.", "But a stunning start to the back nine brought Ko back into contention, and at one point was just one shot off the lead.", "Starting with a birdie on the 11th hole, Ko went on a run of four birdies in five holes to move back to two-under par heading towards the end of her first round.", "But one last bogey on the 18th brought Ko back to one-under, seeing her finish in a five-way tie for 14th place.", "Mexico's Gaby Lopes holds the outright lead at five-under, while the American trio of Danielle Kang, Ryann O'Toole and Nelly Korda as well as Japan's Yuka Saso are one shot back in a four way tie for second."]
